title: Jennifer Lopez's dressing gown fashion 'fail' was actually from film
text:
They’re usually spot on with their showbiz round-up, but there were red-faces all round as Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford hosted Thursday’s edition of This Morning.

The husband and wife duo offered their two-penny's worth on photos taken during Jennifer Lopez's recent appearance in New York, where she was seen wearing a white dressing gown over a glittering evening dress on the red carpet.

But while at first glace it looked like the Latina star had opted for an unconventional look, she was merely taking a break while shooting a glamorous scene on the set of her forthcoming film, Marry Me.

Awkward: They’re usually spot on with their showbiz round-up, but there were red-faces all round as Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford hosted Thursday’s edition of This Morning

Unfortunately for Eamonn an Ruth they were at the mercy of blundering researchers, who wrongly assumed the pictures were taken during a real showbiz event.

Worse, the couple made sure the item took pride of place at the top of a celebrity feature, ironically titled Embarrassing Fashion Fails.

Completely unaware of the hole she was digging, Ruth, 59, remarked: ‘We’re going to be talking about embarrassing fashion fails, and you may have seen this picture of Jennifer Lopez on the red carpet in her dressing gown and slippers.

'She walked into the event in her beautiful gown! Most people would nip out the back, go “Right I’m finished,” and put their dressing gown and slippers on, but she walked back down the red carpet, and hence was snapped by all the photographers.'

Here she comes: The husband and wife co-hosts offered their opinion on photos taken during Jennifer Lopez' recent appearance in New York, where she was seen wearing a white dressing gown on the red carpet

Chortling alongside his wife, Eamonn, 59, joked that she was 'probably gong to the chippie,' prompting an oblivious Ruth to add: 'She's Jenny From The Block isn't she? She's keeping it real.'

However there was no event, there were no photographers and the situation was far from real, with Jennifer simply wrapping up while taking a well earned break on the set of her latest film.

Marry Me, is based on the Bobby Crosby's web comic in which a romantically desperate pop star sees a fan holding a 'Marry Me' sign and takes him up on the offer.

Hard at work: Worn over a sparking silver gown, the Latina star was merely taking a break while filming a glamorous scene on the set of her forthcoming film, Marry Me

In good company: Jennifer was joined by co-star Owen Wilson as she filmed her latest scenes

Jennifer plays leading lady, Kat Valdes, who is left at the altar by her rocker fiance, Bastian, played by Maluma.

It is at this chaotic wedding, held in Madison Square Garden, that she spots her fan, played by Wilson, in the crowd and makes him her groom.

The film is scheduled for release in 2020.
description: The husband and wife co-hosts offered their opinion on photos taken during Jennifer Lopez' recent appearance in her native New York.
